aWLI_StateProvision.content: IV. OTHER CONDITIONS OF THE CONTRACT 23. Amendment of insurance contract 23.1. The Policyholder and Insurer may have the Insurance Contract amended as and when agreed so in writing. 23.2. The Insurer and the Policyholder shall confirm amendments to the Insurance Contract by signing those, unless stipulated otherwise in the Insurance Contract. 23.3. The Insurer shall stipulate which types of amendments to the Insurance Contract may be made remotely via online banking facility, provided that the Policyholder and the Bank have entered into the "Remote Banking Services Agreement". 24. Termination of Insurance Contract 24. 1. The Policyholder shall be entitled to terminate the Insurance Contract unilaterally. In such an event the party wishing to terminate the Insurance Contract shall be required to deliver a relevant written application to the other par ty. The Insurance Contract shall be terminated on the day of receiving the application for termination of the Insurance Contract. 24.2. In case of termination of the Insurance Contract no insurance premiums paid shall be refunded except as stipulated in clause 24.3. 24.3. The Policyholder shall have the right to terminate the Insurance Contract within 15 days of the day the Insurance Contract was entered into (where the Insurance Contract was entered into via remote means of communication, the Policyholder shall be entitled to exercise their right of withdrawal, namely to terminate the Insurance Contract within 30 (thirty) days of the day the Insurance Contract was entered into). In such an event the Insurer shall refund to the Policyholder the Insurance Premium paid by the Policyholder in full. To terminate the Insurance Contract, the Policyholder shall give a relevant written notice to the Insurer thereof. 25. Liability of the Parties and Exchange of Information 25.1. The Policyholder, upon entry into the Insurance Contract, shall have a duty to provide the Insurer with all and any information requested by the Insurer. 25.2. If the Policyholder, at the time of entry into the Insurance Contract has provided the Insurer with false information about the circumstances, which are material for the assessment of probability of occurrence of the insured risk, or has deliberatel y withheld the relevant information, the Insurance Contract shall be deemed null and void as from the moment it was entered into. No Insurance Premiums paid shall be refunded in such an event. 25.3. The Policyholder undertakes to keep the Insurer informed in written from during the Insurance Contract about any changes in the Policyholder's contact details or personal details given in the Insurance Policy. Such changes shall be enclosed with the Insurance Contract. 25. 4. All and any notifications and applications to the Insurer related to the Insurance Contract shall be submitted in such a form and in such a manner as to enable the Insurer to identify the person giving the notification or the app lication. 25.5. The Insurer shall send their notices and information to the Policyholder by post to the latest address notified by the Policyholder. In case of the Policyholder changing their mailing address without informing the Insurer th ereof, all notices shall be deemed received on the 5 (fifth) day following the delivery of the relevant consignment to the post office. If the Policyholder has notified the Insurer of their e-mail address, the Insurer shall have the right to send its notices to the e-mail address given by the Policyholder, which shall be deemed equivalent to sending the notice to the Policyholder's mailing address. The Insurer shall have the right to send information and notices pertaining to the Insurance Contract also via online banking facility, provided that the Insurer and the Bank have entered into the "Remote Banking Services Agreement". The Insurer shall have the right advise the Policyholder of changes in its contact details via mass media. 26. Personal Data 26. 1. The Insurer shall be liable for processing of personal data. 26.2. The processing of personal data is necessary for the Insurer for entry into the Insurance Contract and for performance of obligations under the Insurance Contract. The Insurer is the controller of the registered personal dat a processing system, and the Bank is the personal data operator. 26.3. After expiration the Insurance Contract and when the obligations between the Insurer and the Policyholder have ceased to exist, and the data is no longer necessary for their purpose of processing, the Policyholder, who is also the Insure d, shall have the right to demand that their personal data be removed from electronic databases and that the processing of their personal data be discontinued. 26.4. The Policyholder, who is also the Insured, shall have the right, at any time, to demand correction, addition or modification of their personal data, as well as to demand provision of information about and access to the personal data that is processed regarding this person. 27. Dispute Settlement 27.1. The Parties shall be guided by legislation of the Republic of Latvia in the entry into and performance of the Insurance Contract. 27.2. In case any provision of the Insurance Contract is deemed invalid due to it being at variance with the applicable legislation, it will not constitute grounds to invalidate the entire Insurance Contract or other provisions of the Insurance Contract. 27.3. All matters not contemplated in the Insurance Contract, as well as any dispute, disagreement or claim arising from the Insurance Contract, affecting the Insurance Contract, or the amendment, breach, termination, lawfulness, validity, or interpretation of the Insurance Contract shall be resolved through negotiation. 27.4. In case no resolution is reached through negotiation, the dispute in question shall, at the discretion of the claimant, be referred to court of law in accordance with legislation in force in the United States.
